description.last_approved_text: Your [[b]]governance[[/b]] represents your rightful authority over the lands and the people; increasing this will allow you to expand your [[b]]domain[[/b]].

effects.description: Your [[b]]governance[[/b]] represents your rightful authority over the lands and the people; increasing this will allow you to expand your [[b]]domain[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: Governance can be gained by securing the [[b]]co-operation[[/b]] of other factions – thereby making them your [[b]]vassals[[/b]] – and by constructing [[b]]lodging[[/b]] buildings throughout your domain.

effects.description: Governance can be gained by securing the [[b]]co-operation[[/b]] of other factions – thereby making them your [[b]]vassals[[/b]] – and by constructing [[b]]lodging[[/b]] buildings throughout your domain.

description.last_approved_text: Your [[b]]fortitude[[/b]] is a measure of your military prowess, your ability to [[b]]inspire your allies[[/b]], and [[b]]strike fear[[/b]] into the hearts of your [[b]]enemies[[/b]]!

effects.description: Your [[b]]fortitude[[/b]] is a measure of your military prowess, your ability to [[b]]inspire your allies[[/b]], and [[b]]strike fear[[/b]] into the hearts of your [[b]]enemies[[/b]]!

description.last_approved_text: Increase your [[b]]fortitude[[/b]] through [[b]]winning battles[[/b]], and by inflicting greater [[b]]casualties[[/b]] upon [[b]]enemy forces[[/b]] than they inflict upon yours.

effects.description: Increase your [[b]]fortitude[[/b]] through [[b]]winning battles[[/b]], and by inflicting greater [[b]]casualties[[/b]] upon [[b]]enemy forces[[/b]] than they inflict upon yours.

description.last_approved_text: This represents the level of [[b]]influence[[/b]] of the [[b]]bureaucrats[[/b]] within your court; characters that support the bureaucracy have been influenced by the politics of the [[b]]eunuchs[[/b]].

effects.description: This represents the level of [[b]]influence[[/b]] of the [[b]]bureaucrats[[/b]] within your court; characters that support the bureaucracy have been influenced by the politics of the [[b]]eunuchs[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: This represents the level of [[b]]influence[[/b]] of the imperial [[b]]dynasty[[/b]] within your court; characters that support your dynasty seek to centralise power within the empire.

effects.description: This represents the level of [[b]]influence[[/b]] of the imperial [[b]]dynasty[[/b]] within your court; characters that support your dynasty seek to centralise power within the empire.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Influence[[/b]] can be modified by assigning supporters to positions within the [[b]]imperial court[[/b]], or removing people from their current posts. Low level [[b]]ministers[[/b]] do not carry as much influence as the higher positions.

effects.description: [[b]]Influence[[/b]] can be modified by assigning supporters to positions within the [[b]]imperial court[[/b]], or removing people from their current posts. Low level [[b]]ministers[[/b]] do not carry as much influence as the higher positions.

description.last_approved_text: Whether by decree, favours or coercion, your [[b]]political influence[[/b]] allows you to reform the empire as you wish, divided as it is by the ambitions of the [[b]]bureaucrats[[/b]], the [[b]]warlords[[/b]] and those loyal to your [[b]]dynasty[[/b]].

effects.description: Whether by decree, favours or coercion, your [[b]]political influence[[/b]] allows you to reform the empire as you wish, divided as it is by the ambitions of the [[b]]bureaucrats[[/b]], the [[b]]warlords[[/b]] and those loyal to your [[b]]dynasty[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: Your [[b]]political influence[[/b]] is increased by specific [[b]]buildings[[/b]] and through numerous [[b]]events[[/b]]; it may be [[b]]invested[[/b]] towards [[b]]restructuring the imperial court[[/b]] and the [[b]]annexation[[/b]] of territories or factions.

effects.description: Your [[b]]political influence[[/b]] is increased by specific [[b]]buildings[[/b]] and through numerous [[b]]events[[/b]]; it may be [[b]]invested[[/b]] towards [[b]]restructuring the imperial court[[/b]] and the [[b]]annexation[[/b]] of territories or factions.

description.last_approved_text: This represents the level of [[b]]influence[[/b]] of the [[b]]warlords' factions[[/b]] within your court; characters that support the warlords seek to decentralise power within the empire.

effects.description: This represents the level of [[b]]influence[[/b]] of the [[b]]warlords' factions[[/b]] within your court; characters that support the warlords seek to decentralise power within the empire.

description.last_approved_text: As war rages and settlements fall, the amount of [[b]]displaced population[[/b]] rises; you may [[b]]exploit this[[/b]] to support your [[b]]military ambitions[[/b]], but it will lead to [[b]]increased food consumption[[/b]].

effects.description: As war rages and settlements fall, the amount of [[b]]displaced population[[/b]] rises; you may [[b]]exploit this[[/b]] to support your [[b]]military ambitions[[/b]], but it will lead to [[b]]increased food consumption[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: You may assign characters to help [[b]]resettle displaced populations[[/b]] and [[b]]increase growth[[/b]] in your own {{tr:map_provinces}}, all the while establishing [[b]]positive sentiment[[/b]] among the people.

effects.description: You may assign characters to help [[b]]resettle displaced populations[[/b]] and [[b]]increase growth[[/b]] in your own {{tr:map_provinces}}, all the while establishing [[b]]positive sentiment[[/b]] among the people.

description.last_approved_text: Watch out as the [[b]]Yellow Turban Rebellion[[/b]] can spread [[b]]fervour[[/b]] throughout your settlements. Stop this spread using assignments, [[b]]public order[[/b]] buildings or by crushing the rebellion.

effects.description: Watch out as the [[b]]Yellow Turban Rebellion[[/b]] can spread [[b]]fervour[[/b]] throughout your settlements. Stop this spread using assignments, [[b]]public order[[/b]] buildings or by crushing the rebellion.

description.last_approved_text: Settling the [[b]]displaced population[[/b]] using Tao Qian's unique [[b]]assignment[[/b]] will bring order and stability back to the land. When Tao Qian [[b]]occupies settlements[[/b]] he does not create [[b]]displaced populations[[/b]].

description.last_approved_text: High [[b]]displaced populations[[/b]] can be exploited to reduce [[b]]militia recruitment cost[[/b]], [[b]]construction time[[/b]] and [[b]]mustering time[[/b]], but will result in a drastic increase in food consumption. Keeping it low has a positive effect on [[b]]public order[[/b]], [[b]]satisfaction[[/b]] and [[b]]peasantry income[[/b]].

[[b]]Fame and fortune[[/b]] can only be gained through military actions during a mercenary contract.

[[b]]Inflicting casualties[[/b]] against the target's forces and [[b]]gifting their seized settlements[[/b]] will generate this resource.

This value resets with each new contract.

description.last_approved_text: Having [[b]]Reckless Luck[[/b]] allows Sun Ce to expand rapidly and with relative ease. However, as time passes his luck will begin to deplete and its potency decays. [[b]]Reckless Luck[[/b]] can be regained by completing Sun Ce ambitions. If Sun Ce's luck ever runs out, he instantly dies.

effects.description: Having [[b]]Reckless Luck[[/b]] allows Sun Ce to expand rapidly and with relative ease. However, as time passes his luck will begin to deplete and its potency decays. [[b]]Reckless Luck[[/b]] can be regained by completing Sun Ce ambitions. If Sun Ce's luck ever runs out, he instantly dies.

description.last_approved_text: Sun Ce has many grand ambitions - ambitions he needs to achieve quickly. He seeks to avenge his father, recruit legendary characters into his court, and found the kingdom of Wu. By fulfilling Sun Ce's ambitions, [[b]] Reckless Luck[[/b]] will decay slower and his faction will gain additional bonuses.

effects.description: Sun Ce has many grand ambitions - ambitions he needs to achieve quickly. He seeks to avenge his father, recruit legendary characters into his court, and found the kingdom of Wu. By fulfilling Sun Ce's ambitions, [[b]] Reckless Luck[[/b]] will decay slower and his faction will gain additional bonuses.

description.last_approved_text: A unique court action allows Sun Ce to spend [[b]]Shared Expertise[[/b]] to instantly grant experience to characters, helping them to rank up. \n\n Depending on their rank, characters generate shared expertise points each turn: rank 3 or higher characters generate 1 point, rank 5 or higher characters generate 2 points, rank 8 or higher characters generate 3 points, and rank 10 characters generate 4 points.

effects.description: A unique court action allows Sun Ce to spend [[b]]Shared Expertise[[/b]] to instantly grant experience to characters, helping them to rank up. \n\n Depending on their rank, characters generate shared expertise points each turn: rank 3 or higher characters generate 1 point, rank 5 or higher characters generate 2 points, rank 8 or higher characters generate 3 points, and rank 10 characters generate 4 points.

description.last_approved_text: The characters in Sun Ce's court are what defines his faction bonuses. The effects of Sun Ce ministerial position depend on the rank of the character in each position. Low-ranking characters apply a weak effect, high-ranking characters apply a strong effect. However, Sun Ce does not get faction-wide bonuses for increasing his faction rank; he only gets more ministerial positions per rank.

description.last_approved_text: King Mulu knows well how to support his people and push them to achieve their best. Mulu has access to more economic reforms before uniting the tribes and can research [[b]]Economic Reforms[[/b]] faster.

description.last_approved_text: Wild Fire is accumulated each turn, the amount of gain altering each season. Its effects, too, differ per season, but generally make Zhurong's armies hugely powerful on the battlefield.

effects.description: Wild Fire is accumulated each turn, the amount of gain altering each season. Its effects, too, differ per season, but generally make Zhurong's armies hugely powerful on the battlefield.

description.last_approved_text: The world and nature work together, in a cyclical system, as Lady Zhurong does with war. She spends much time planning, preparing and gathering her strength before launching into battle with [[b]]Wild Fire[[/b]]. During this time, she is essentially unbeatable on the battlefield. Yet once her fire has died out, she is vulnerable and must recover her strength before this cycle begins anew.

effects.description: The world and nature work together, in a cyclical system, as Lady Zhurong does with war. She spends much time planning, preparing and gathering her strength before launching into battle with [[b]]Wild Fire[[/b]]. During this time, she is essentially unbeatable on the battlefield. Yet once her fire has died out, she is vulnerable and must recover her strength before this cycle begins anew.

description.last_approved_text: Through her supposed ancestral connection to eponymous fire deity, Lady Zhurong gains temporary access to their power; [[b]]Wild Fire[[/b]]. When the effect is granted, all of Lady Zhurong's armies receive massive bonuses to their abilities in battle. Wild Fire has five variants – one for each season of the year.

effects.description: Through her supposed ancestral connection to eponymous fire deity, Lady Zhurong gains temporary access to their power; [[b]]Wild Fire[[/b]]. When the effect is granted, all of Lady Zhurong's armies receive massive bonuses to their abilities in battle. Wild Fire has five variants – one for each season of the year.

description.last_approved_text: As they march, Lady Zhurong and her warriors constantly chant to the fire-god – Zhurong – and prepare themselves for coming battle. This constant state of readiness inspires morale, but causes them to consume their supplies at a faster rate.

description.last_approved_text: [[b]]Undercover network[[/b]] is built up over time by active [[b]]spies[[/b]] and is spent on performing actions. This faction benefits from a reduction to its [[b]]undercover network[[/b]] costs as well as increasing the cost for foreign spies that are currently infiltrating.
